articles.author: Steve Holland, Nandita Bose
articles.description: Donald Trump and Kamala Harris both predicted victory as they campaigned across Pennsylvania on Monday in the final, frantic day of an exceptionally close U.S. presidential election.
articles.title: Trump and Harris make final pitch in Pennsylvania on eve of historic vote

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: The Israeli military said, without giving details, that its forces had "eliminated terrorists" in the central Gaza Strip and Jabalia area.
articles.title: Israeli airstrikes kill at least 30 Palestinians in Gaza, medics say

articles.author: Praveen Paramasivam
articles.description: With sacred chants, ringing of bells and offerings of flowers and bananas, a Hindu priest in Kamala Harris' ancestral village in southern India conducted prayers on Tuesday for her victory in the U.S. presidential election.
articles.title: In her Indian grandfather's village, residents pray for Kamala Harris win

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The main political ally of longstanding Turkish leader Tayyip Erdogan said on Tuesday that a constitutional amendment should be considered to allow the president to run again in elections set for 2028.
articles.title: Erdogan ally floats Turkey constitutional amendment to let him extend his tenure

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Irish Prime Minister Simon Harris said on Tuesday that he plans to call a parliamentary election later this week, likely setting up a polling date for the end of the month.
articles.title: Irish PM to call general election this week

articles.author: Ariba Shahid
articles.description: Two Chinese nationals were wounded on Tuesday by a security guard who opened fire at a garment factory in Pakistan's commercial hub Karachi, in the latest in a string of attacks that have spurred Beijing to demand better security for its citizens.
articles.title: Two Chinese nationals shot and wounded in Pakistan

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Swiss police have arrested 15 drug traffickers operating around the Verbier mountain resort as part of the biggest ever swoop in the surrounding Valais canton, police said on Tuesday.
articles.title: Swiss police catch more than a dozen drug traffickers in Verbier bust

articles.author: Krishna N. Das
articles.description: India plans to overhaul its criminal sentencing norms to counter accusations of arbitrary punishment, sources said, following public outrage over the 2022 rape conviction of a man within 30 minutes of trial, by a judge who handed him the death penalty.
articles.title: Exclusive: India aims to curb judges' arbitrary sentences for criminals, sources say

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russia launched a Soyuz rocket early on Tuesday carrying two satellites designed to monitor the space weather around Earth and 53 small satellites, including two Iranian ones, Russia's Roscosmos space agency said.
articles.title: Russia launches Soyuz rocket with dozens of satellites, including two from Iran

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Britain's Prince William paid a visit to South African President Cyril Ramaphosa on Tuesday in Cape Town after taking a nature walk with rangers and conservationists at Table Mountain National Park.
articles.title: Prince William meets President Ramaphosa on South Africa trip
